intro: Polypodium oligosorum, commonly known as the slender wall fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, linear fronds that are typically 20–40 cm in length. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. It thrives in shaded, moist environments such as rock crevices and forest floors. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of its fertile fronds, contributing to its reproductive strategy.
